Package src.recomanador.domini

Class ConjuntItems

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Item>
          • src.recomanador.domini.ConjuntItems
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Item>, java.util.Collection<Item>, java.util.List<Item>, java.util.RandomAccess
    public class ConjuntItems
extends java.util.ArrayList<Item>
    This class represents a set of items in the form of an ArrayList extension. It keeps the items sorted according to the item's ID, to achieve better performance when modifying this list.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • maxAtributs

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> maxAtributs
        Maximum attributes for each column. Columns with strings, names and booleans will have random data

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConjuntItems

        public ConjuntItems()
        Empty constructor

      • ConjuntItems

        public ConjuntItems​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> items)
             throws src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemTypeNotValidException,
                    src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException
        Constructor with an array of items. This array is subdivided for atributes with ; For each item it is assigned an array of strings. Furthermore: -Automatically detects the attributes types -Calculates the maximums and minimums of the attributes -Defaults all the weights to its maximum value (100) -Fills the array with the names of each attribute -Sets the position of id to the attribute with name id -Sorts all items
        Parameters:
        items - Array of an array of atributes. The first must be a header with the name of each attribute
        Throws:
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemTypeNotValidException - Is thrown when the header does not contain "id" or when it is not valid
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException - Is thrown if it tries to assign a weight out of the range (0-100)

      • ConjuntItems

        public ConjuntItems​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> items,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> pesos,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Item.tipus> tipusAtribut,
                    int id,
                    int nomA,
                    java.lang.String nom,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> maxAtributs,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> minAtributs)
             throws src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException
        Constructor with an array of items, weights, attribute types, maximum attributes, minimum attributes, a string for the name, the position of the id attribute and the position of the name attribute.
        Parameters:
        items - Array of an array of atributes. The first must be a header with the name of each attribute
        pesos - Array of weights for each attribute
        tipusAtribut - Array of types of each attributes
        id - Position of the attribute "id" in the array of name of attributes
        nomA - Position of the attribute of the name of each item in the array of name of attributes
        nom - Name that represents the set
        maxAtributs - Array of the maximum attributes of each column
        minAtributs - Array of the minimum attributes of each column
        Throws:
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException - Is thrown if it tries to assign a weight out of the range (0-100)

        public static void setPesos​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> p)
                     throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                            src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException
        Sets the weights to the parameter array
        Parameters:
        p - ArrayList that contains a weight for each attribute
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the input array is different than the number of attributes
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException - if the weights are outside the range (0 - 100)

                   throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                          src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException
        Sets the weight of the column col to the paramenter p
        Parameters:
        p - new weight that will be assigned
        col - column which weight will be changed
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if col is bigger than the number of attributes or smaller than 0
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException - if the weight is outside the range (0 - 100)

        t - type which will be checked
        Returns:

      • inicialitzar

        public boolean inicialitzar​(int nAtributs)
                     throws src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemTypeNotValidException,
                            src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException
        Initializes the set and the basic attributes such as the weight array and the type array, this allows acces to the arrays knowing that they won't be null
        Parameters:
        nAtributs - number of attributes that the items in each set has
        Returns:
        returns true if it exists an attribute named "id"
        Throws:
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemTypeNotValidException - if it is tried to modify a column type that is not correct
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemWeightNotCorrectException - if a weight outside the range (0 - 100) is tried to be assigned

      • distanciaAtribut

        public static float distanciaAtribut​(java.lang.String a1,
                                     java.lang.String a2,
                                     int columna)
                              throws src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemTypeNotValidException
        Computes the similarity between to strings that belong to the same column. The similarity for each type is measured differently
        Parameters:
        a1 - first string to be compared
        a2 - second string to be compared
        columna - column to which a1 and a2 belong
        Returns:
        float between 0 and 1 where 0 means completely different and 1 means exaclty the same
        Throws:
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemTypeNotValidException - if a1 and a2 are not of the same type

      • distanciaItem

        public static float distanciaItem​(Item i1,
                                  Item i2)
                           throws src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemTypeNotValidException
        Computes and returns the similarity between two items comparing their attributes individually
        Parameters:
        i1 - first item to be compared
        i2 - second item to be compared
        Returns:
        float between 0 and 1 where 0 means completely different and 1 means exaclty the same
        Throws:
        src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemTypeNotValidException - if the two items cannot be compared

      • binarySearchItem

        public static int binarySearchItem​(java.util.ArrayList<Item> list,
                                   int id,
                                   int lo,
                                   int hi)
        Basic binary search adapted to work with Items
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of Items
        id - target to search for
        lo - lower bound
        hi - upper bound
        Returns:
        returns -1 if the target is not in the list, otherwise, the position of the target in the list
